newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Chairman lifts stake in Star Telecom.
newsitem.headline: Chairman lifts stake in Star Telecom.

text.p: Star Telecom International Holdings Ltd said on Monday its Chairman Wong Kam Fu and his wife Chu Wai Fun have lifted their holdings in the company to a total of 55.1 percent of its enlarged share capital from 50.3 percent after exercised all their 1996 warrants in the company.
The couple exercised 50.75 million warrants at HK$3.10 per shares and compared to the shares' last close of HK$2.60 each on Friday, the Paging services operator said in a statement.

It said the chairman borrowed HK$180 million from China Strategic Holdings Ltd, secured by 110 million Star Telecom shares amounting to 20.95 percent of the firm. Wong used HK$157.32 million from the loan to exercise the warrants.
It said Wong and his wife also granted Grand Orient Ltd, a wholly-owned unit of China Strategic, an option to purchase up to 144.59 million Star Eelecom shares at HK$2.00 per share.
The option, representing about 27.5 percent of the company's issued capital enlarged by the warrants, can be exercised any time after December 19, 1996 to July 7, 1997.

In the event that the option is exercised Grand Orient and persons acting in concert with it may or may not be required to make a general offer for all the shares depending on the voting rights controlled by them, Star Telecom said.
The China Stragetic group does not own any shares or warrants of the company currently.
